summary: Nancy P. Schultz was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates, indicating her involvement in the committee's operations during that period. The consistency of her appearance in these payroll documents suggests she was a regular staff member of the SCAS.
significance: Nancy P. Schultz's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her role in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents.
